questions.text: A villager was assaulted by 4-5 people & brought to hospital in serious condition. His dying declaration was being taken in hospital. What is correct regarding this process?

options.label: D
options.text: Oath is compulsory before recording the statement

questions.correct_answer: A. Magistrate can record the statement
questions.explanation:
Feature

Dying Declaration

Dying Deposition

Recorder

Anyone—Magistrate/doctor/village headman/police/any member of the public

Always recorded by a Magistrate

Oath (Option D)

Not required

Must be taken

Accused or his counsel

Not present

Always present

Cross-examination

Not done

Done

Legal value

Comparatively less

Much more

Admissibility if declarant survives

Not admitted, but has corroborative value

Fully admitted

Nature

Merely recording of statement

Complete court procedure

Type of evidence

Documentary

Oral

Status in India

Followed

Not followed

Leading Qs (Option C)

Not Permitted

Permitted

questions.text: A married female died in unnatural condition within 3 years of marriage. Her father filed a report to police and inquiry will be done under which section?
questions.explanation:
Feature

Police Inquest

Magistrate Inquest

Conducted by

Police officer

Magistrate (DM, SDM, Judicial, or Executive Magistrate)

Involvement of witnesses

Requires signatures of panchas

Does not require witness signatures

Witness statements

Admissible in court

Not admissible in court

Can order arrest

No, but can arrest in cognizable offenses

Can issue arrest warrants

Exhumation

Cannot order exhumation

Can order exhumation of a body

Autopsy orders

Sends bodies for autopsy indiscriminately

Orders autopsy only when necessary

Forensic analysis

Cannot order chemical analysis of viscera

Can order chemical analysis

questions.text: Who order the autopsy in case of RTA?
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - P

questions.text: A forensic expert received a summons from the district court to record his evidence in a criminal case, but two days prior, he already received a summons for a civil case in the same district court for the same date. What should the doctor do?

options.label: B
options.text: Attend the court for which the summons came first.

options.label: C
options.text: Attend the court for the criminal case.

questions.correct_answer: C. Attend the court for the criminal case.

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl is brought to the OPD by her mother with a complaint of abdominal pain. The patient's urine pregnancy test (UPT) is positive. What should be the first step by you as a medical officer?

options.label: C
options.text: Take consent from the patient's mother

questions.text: The authority who investigates the death of a 14-year-old girl who was abducted by a man and subsequently died while in police custody will be?
The first-hand knowledge rule is applicable to which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - C

Witness Type

Rule

Explanation

Common Witness

First-hand Knowledge

A common witness must have personally observed or experienced the event in question and can provide testimony based on their direct knowledge of the event.

Handwriting Expert

Expert Opinion

A handwriting expert provides testimony based on their specialized knowledge and training in analyzing and comparing handwriting samples.

Doctor

Expert Opinion

A doctor may provide expert testimony based on their medical knowledge, professional experience, and interpretation of medical records and test results.

Hostile Witness

Cross-Examination

A hostile witness is subject to cross-examination by opposing counsel to challenge their testimony, credibility, or biases, but no specific rule applies to them directly.

questions.text: What is the appropriate course of action following the observation of cigarette burn marks on the forearm of a 14-year-old girl who presents to a doctor with a fractured forearm, claiming to have fallen and hit her hand?

options.label: B
options.text: To do a complete physical examination

options.label: C
options.text: To tell or discuss with colleagues that she is a case of abuse

options.label: D
options.text: To call local social worker for help

questions.correct_answer: B. To do a complete physical examination
questions.explanation:
Correct Option B - To do a complete ph

 

Protection of Children from Sexual Offenses (POCSO) Act

Enacted

2012 (Amended in 2019)

Objective

To provide legal protection to children against sexual offenses and create a child-friendly legal system for their investigation and trial

Applicability

Covers all children under the age of 18 years

Types of Offenses
  • Penetrative sexual assault
  • Aggravated penetrative sexual assault
  • Sexual assault
  • Aggravated sexual assault
  • Other offenses against children

Reporting and Investigation Process
  • Reporting to the police or designated authorities
  • Recording of statements in a child-friendly manner
  • Medical examination and forensic evidence collection
  • Support services for the child during the investigation

questions.text: If a healthcare professional is found guilty of professional misconduct , they must provide the patient's records promptly upon request, within:
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - 72 hou

questions.text: When an individual commences employment with a second employer , the new employer assumes responsibility for the individual's actions, under which doctrine ?
questions.explanation: Correct Option D - Borrowed serv

questions.text: Death registration in India done within?
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - 2

questions.text: A 16-year-old girl was rescued from a village in Bihar where she had been sold off by her father for Rs. 25000 to a 45-year-old man . On examination, she was found to be 12 weeks pregnant . She was granted permission to abort the pregnancy, taking into consideration the age of the girl and the circumstances of her pregnancy . A doctor who will be eligible to perform the abortion for this girl should have performed at least how many MTP prior to this?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - 25:

questions.text: Which article in the constitution does not pertain to children ?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - A

Article Number

Article Title and Description

Article 21A

Right to Education: The State shall provide free and compulsory education to all children in the age group of 6 to 14 years.

Article 24

Prohibition of employment of children in hazardous occupations or engaged in any form of forced labor.

Article 45

Provision of early childhood care and education for children below the age of six years.

questions.text: Which section of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) is associated with the penalization of perjury ?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - Section 193 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC)

Section

Offense/Topic

Section 191

Giving false evidence

Section 192

Fabricating false evidence

Section 193

Punishment for false evidence

Section 196

Using evidence known to be false

Section 197

Issuing or signing false certificate

Section 201

Causing disappearance of evidence

questions.text: What is the responsibility of the doctor in recording the dying declaration of a victim affected by a fire ?

options.label: B
options.text: To record the statement even in the presence of magistrate

options.label: D
options.text: Put the person under oath before declaration

questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - T

Dying Declaration

  • It is followed in India

  • It is the statement given by the dying patient

  • This statement can be a

    • Oral statement

    • Document

  • It is based on the 32 IEA

  • The declaration can be given by

    • Victim

    • Magistrate

    • Doctor

    • Police

    • Any person

  • Not recommended

    • Oath

    • Cross-examination

    • Leading questions

Dying Deposition

  • It is followed in developed countries

  • It occurs in the presence of the

    • Magistrate

    • Defense lawyer

  • Recommendations

    • Oath

    • Cross examination is done (Best to protect the accused)

    • Leadings questions are asked

questions.text: Please arrange the following clauses of IPC 320 in sequential order . Destruction or permanent impairing of the power of any member or joint Permanent disfiguration of the head or face Emasculation Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - 3, 1, 2, 4

questions.text: An 11 year old girl was found to be quiet and shy in her classroom with intermittent crying, for the past few days . It was discovered that her uncle was touching her genitals inappropriately. The duty of the principal is to report this to?
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - P

questions.text: Which of the following statements does not apply during cross-examination in a court of law ?

options.label: A
options.text: Witness is examined by the defense lawyer

options.label: C
options.text: Objective of cross-examination is to weaken case of opponent

options.label: D
options.text: There is no time limit to cross examination

questions.correct_answer: B. Leading questions are not allowed
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - Leading qu

questions.text: As an internal medicine consultant at a private clinic , you are handling the case of a patient who has chronic renal disease and needs hemodialysis . You provide dietary and fluid management recommendations and closely monitor the patient. Unfortunately, the patient decides to take ayurvedic supplements and occasionally disregards your instructions without informing you. Consequently, the patient's condition deteriorates, leading to respiratory distress . Subsequently, the patient's attendant files a legal complaint, accusing the doctor of negligence. Which of the following can serve as a defense for the doctor in court ?
According to the amendment in the medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) Bill of 2020 , until what gestational age is it permissible to induce MTP in mentally ill rape victims?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - 24 week

The MTP Act 1971 and The MTP Act Amendments 2021

 

MTP Act 1971

The MTP Amendment Act 2021

Indications(Contraceptive Failure)

Only applies to married women

Unmarried women are also covered

Gestational Age Limit

20 weeks for all indications
  • 24 weeks for rape survivors
  • Beyond 24 weeks for substantial fetal abnormalities

Medical practitioner opinions required before termination
  • One RMP till 12 weeks
  • Two RMPs till 20 weeks
  • One RMP till 20 weeks
  • Two RMPs 20-24 weeks
  • Medical Board approval after 24 weeks

Breach of the woman’s confidentiality

Fine up to Rs 1000

Fine and/or Imprisonment of 1 year

questions.text: A doctor was summoned as a public witness to appear and record his evidence in court. What is correct about this witness?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - E

questions.text: Medical termination of pregnancy can be done upto 24 weeks in case of?
questions.explanation: Correct Option D -Rape v
